result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaliyah T Guy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Attend the Criminal Thinking Counseling.
No contact with any Kohl's Dept. store in Waukesha County.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 15CF1018 is dismissed and read in.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non-working hours (Huber).
Apply 26 days sentence credit if revoked.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber.
Release for work and to get her GED.
61 days credit.
Any costs/fines remaining are to be entered as a civil judgment.

sentence to jail/huber

Defendant Aaliyah T Guy in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing after revocation. Court imposed the following sentence:

12 months jail with huber for work or for her to get her GED. Defendant given 61 days credit.
Any outstanding fines/court costs to turn into a civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-16-2016 02:30 pm

AMENDED:

Sentencing hearing at 12-22-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Aaliyah T Guy in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Matter cannot proceed to sentencing as the state did not provided enough notice to the victim. Defense requests bail modification and presents arguments. State objects to any modification and presents arguments.  Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed. Court adjourns the matter for tomorrow and state to notify Kohls. 


  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
